snippet: LEAD: Californians have long lived with the knowledge that many of the state's freeways, bridges and buildings might not withstand a major earthquake, but a new report from a state-appointed commission has concluded that even many structures thoug...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: Californians have long lived with the knowledge that many of the state's freeways, bridges and buildings might not withstand a major earthquake, but a new report from a state-appointed commission has concluded that even many structures thought to have been made safe remain dangerous.

headline.main: California Roads Not So Safe in Quakes

byline.original: By RICHARD W. STEVENSON, Special to The New York Times
